body.name: Destiny of the Witch (The Other Witch Series Book 4)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This fourth and final book in Heather G. Harris's Witch series of course, totally fantastic!
reviews.reviewText: Amber's brilliantly woven story comes to an epic and very satisfying conclusion in Destiny of a Witch.Yes, Amber tears down and destroys the evil witches, not without some pain and sadness, but with the work of her many friends and supporters at her side, they overcome and it's marvelous.I've really loved the slow-burn, enemies to lovers romance, between Amber and Bastion with this book detailing what a strong and lovely pair they are and will continue to be. I've said it before, but I'll say it again... Heather is a master storyteller and Amber's story has shown us the best of her skills. Amber’s character has grown so much since we first met her in Jinx's books.My favorite side character is still Benji, and I still want to give him a hug and introduce him to some 80's rock. Heather makes characters, like Benji, feel so utterly real and you can't help to cheer on and race through their adventures to be sure they made it safely to the final page (but seriously, how many times does my favorite side character need to almost die?).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Destiny of the witch brings Amber’s story to its conclusion. This is the fourth book in the series, and as such it is not a standalone: yes you need to have read the other books first, and preferably both Jinx and Lucy’s series too.It’s down to the wire for Amber and Bastion, as they start their hunt for the leaders of the Evil Coven.Amber is still trying to help her mother, just as she is trying to stop those who want to use the evil magic, fortunately she has managed to gather some good friends who are willing to help.Without trying to spoiler things, let’s just say we get some names, as well as some answers in this book, and I was quite satisfied with where it all lead.It was an action packed book, with Amber and Bastion having their work cut out for them. Amber is finally coming into her own, and making waves while she does it!There were some nice cameos from Lucy and Jinx - and even Esme got to make me smile.All in all, this one ended with a bit of a bang, and a rather happy/satisfied smile from me. Well worth the effort of reading the series, the urban fantasy enthusiast will find themselves enthralled by the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I can't get enough of the Other Realm books! I have loved every book in the Jinx series, the Lucy series, and now Amber's series. I am excited for the newest book in Lucy's series coming out soon, but am sad to say goodbye to Amber and Bastion. I honestly envy anyone who is just starting these. I may end up getting the audiobooks to revisit all the adventures. Love, love, love!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Amber & Bastion continue to grow closer
reviews.reviewText: Of course, they still need to track down evil witches, especially her father. She’s still trying to save her mother and unlock the CD about her father’s nefarious activities. There’s normal Coven business and Amber’s ongoing appreciation of friendship.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing End to Amber's Series
reviews.reviewText: But hopefully not the last book about Amber and her life.This book was full of twists and turns and was one of the best books Heather G Harris has written to date. I don't know if it is that Amber is more mature than either Jinx or Lucy and that comes across or if the more Other Realm HGH writes, the more colorful and well thought out the stories become.This was wrapped up nicely without feeling forced or rushed.I truly can't wait for the next book from the Other Realm.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love Amber and Bastian, and was sad to see that this was the last book in the series. In this book, Amber figures out why the potion that she made for her mom issue is not working, and she also finds out more about the prophecy about herself. Apparently she is not found all the black, coven moles that are in her coven, and she hast to search them out. When she finds some of them, it’s very interesting person they did not expect. I’m sad to see this series go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A bit of everything, action, romance, and drama. Some of the storylines are wrapped up but there is still room for more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love this book!!
reviews.reviewText: There is absolutely nothing I can think to say that won’t be a spoiler! I just want to rave about this book and the whole series! And Lucy’s series! And Jinx’s series! Oh My Goodness! !We find out who the evil witch is. We get shocking revelations about other evil witches. We find out why Amber’s mum isn’t getting better.And a witch who thought she needed no one discovers that family and found family are a comfort and a strength.

What an awesome conclusion to Amber's focused books.With action, battles, friends, and family - this book is a prime example of Heather's amazing world.Amber has taken the first place of my fav Otherworld characters, (and it helps that her friends are right there at her side so technically I didn't choose to bump anyone).Definitely another great read by a great author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Brilliant finale to an awesome series!
reviews.reviewText: Heather Harris has done it again! Reading Amber’s tale makes me feel like I can achieve anything and I am determined to start every day with a positive affirmation too!The story itself is full of twists and turns and it is difficult to keep track of whom is friend or foe! It is a well paced story that demands to be read in a single sitting! It was also wonderful to have a leading woman who was in her forties, not her twenties, and still being a kick-ass hero! I’m hoping that despite this being the end of this series that there will be more stories with Amber and Bastion; after all, as Amber said, there are still more evil witches (love the rebranding) to be rooted out!Thank you, Heather Harris, for another excellent read!

Some delightful trusts. All the wonderful characters we are addicted to. Thoroughly enjoyed the story and sad to say farewell (hopefully temporarily) to the world.First author to tempt me into abandoning a different book / series half way through- simply could not wait to read the latest adventure on that day it was available.

This has to be my favourite book of my Favourite Otherworld series. The only disappointing thing about this book is it’s the last in this series. Loved the witch world, loved Amber and Bastion, along with the rest of their friends. I’d love to see more books with them and Benji in them

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Loved this series the 'last' (currently) of her other realm series ( reading order Glimmer, Wolf, Court then Witch)The return of some of the previous series favourites ties everything together. Although they can be read as individual series I would suggest reading each series in order.Some triggers including suicide, kidnapping, violence+, betrayal, dementiaI loved the humour of the main characters and the 'cup quotes'. The spice is implied but not really described so is only 🌶️
